intro: Hedeoma schwackeana, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Hedeoma schwackeana is often found in open areas such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
